title: Which answer is correct, “I have two brothers and two sisters” or “I have 4 siblings”? - Quora

response.answer_text: Both “two brothers and two sisters” and “four siblings” are correct. I’d suggest spelling out “four”; the general rule is that we spell out numbers up to at least twelve, perhaps through twenty. The word “siblings” is used much less often than “brothers and sisters,” but among college-educated, professional people, “siblings” won’t sound strange. The hard-working, friendly person who bags your groceries isn’t likely to say “siblings.”

Although you can say like this, yet I would suggest to limit your expression to the first part of the sentence. I have two brothers and two sisters’. The parents may , however, say ‘ I have four siblings’.
